result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dante Lashun Berry-Compton

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Dante Lashun Berry-Compton in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders case DISMISSED and read-in to 15CF738 for purposes of sentencing.

Defendant Dante Lashun Berry-Compton in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  State informs the court that defendant is being investigated by the Attorney General's office.    Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dante Lashun Berry-Compton in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for plea and sentencing, however defense requests more time.  Court also addresses Justice Point violation.  Court admonishes the defendant, but does not amend bail.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Dante Lashun Berry-Compton in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Status conference held off the record. Defense counsel to prepare for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 22. Per approval, case transferred.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 22.   Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Dante Lashun Berry-Compton in court, attorney Darryl E. Smith contacted the Court.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Pre-trial conference held off the record. Defendant has a pending felony case in Branch 22. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with 3109 S. Kinnikinnic Ave., Walgreens in Milwaukee.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Dante Lashun Berry-Compton in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Dante Lashun Berry-Compton in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 3-16-2015 at 1:30pm
